articles.title: Could Sena MPs be next? After backing to Murmu by one, voices suggest more trouble for Uddhav
articles.description: Shiv Sena Lok Sabha MP Rahul Shewale wrote to Uddhav on Tuesday night asking him to tell party MPs to support Murmu, considering her tribal roots and contribution to the social sector.
articles.content: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena could be next looking at unrest from its parliamentary wing. A day after one Sena MP requested Uddhav to declare support for the NDA’s presidential candidate Droupa… [+3320 chars]

articles.title: Kaali poster row: Filmmaker Leena Manimekalai posts fresh tweet amid outrage
articles.description: Amid a raging row over the "smoking Kaali" movie poster, filmmaker Leena Manimekalai has tweeted a photo that shows two people smoking while dressed in the costumes of Lord Shiva and a Hindu goddess.
articles.content: Filmmaker Leena Manimekalai is caught in the eye of a storm as outrage grows over the poster of her movie Kaali, which depicts the goddess smoking a cigarette. In the wake of several FIRs being filed… [+1836 chars]

articles.title: "Don't Want To Live In An India Where...": Trinamool's Mahua Moitra
articles.description: Amid a spiralling controversy about her comment on Goddess Kali being a "meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra dared the BJP on Wednesday to prove her wrong.
articles.content:
• I am a Kali worshipper. I am a practicing Hindu. The comments were on my own religion. They were not meant to offend.

articles.title: Red alert in Western Maharashtra, very heavy rainfall likely in these states
articles.description: Mumbai is likely to witness another wet day as the IMD has predicted moderate to heavy rain in the city and suburbs, with a possibility of extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places, in the next 24 hours, according to civic officials. | Latest News India

articles.title: UK PM Boris Johnson Fires Senior Minister After He Tells Him To Resign
articles.description: Britain's scandal-hit Prime Minister Boris Johnson attempted a rearguard offensive late Wednesday against a cabinet and Conservative party revolt, firing a top ally and vowing to "fight on" despite dozens of government members resigning.
